title: Wes Nelson shades ex Megan as he says X Factor: Celebrity won't damage new romance
text:
Get the biggest Daily Love Island stories by email Subscribe Thank you for subscribing We have more newsletters Show me See our privacy notice Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email

Wes Nelson threw some serious shade at his ex Megan Barton-Hanson as he said there's no way X Factor : Celebrity could ruin his relationship with Arabella Chi.

Wes and Megan famously split earlier this year while he was taking part in ITV show Dancing On Ice.

Amid rumours he was getting close to his professional partner Vanessa Bauer, his relationship with Megan became fraught and ended rather dramatically.

He's since moved on with another Love Island star, Arabella, but says he's way too confident in the romance to be worried about the effect X Factor could have.

Wes gushed about his relationship as he talked about teaming up with his co-stars Eyal Booker, Samira Mighty and Zara McDermott for the celebrity version of the ITV talent show.

(Image: PA)

When asked if he was worried about being hit by a "curse" again, Wes told heat magazine: "I have absolutely no doubts about my relationship. We get on so well – it’s a very different dynamic to what I’ve had before.

"She’s just so chilled. It’s really nice to be going into this knowing it’s going to be absolutely dandy. Unlike last year, it’s worked so much better just taking a chilled-out approach to this and going through the process like we would have done, regardless of the shows we’ve been on."

So far, the group of reality stars have been dubbed The Islanders, but it seems they're not keen on that actually being their band name.

(Image: Instagram)

Wes said: "It’s a touchy subject. I’m not saying 'The Islanders' , I’ll look like a f**king idiot."

And Eyal added: "We’re still undecided. The Islanders is our name for now. Do you think you’ll surprise some people?

Wes jumped in: "From the outside looking in, you’d think, 'Are they being serious?' I want to shock people and prove we really are artists."

The pals say they're hoping taking part in the show will make people forget they were ever on Love Island.

(Image: Getty)

When asked if that was the aim of the game, Wes said: "Exactly. Think of Little Mix – some of them worked in shops beforehand. It’s exactly the same as looking at us on Love Island and saying, 'You’re never going to be the next pop star'.

"People go on The X Factor with no musical background and end up so successful, so there’s no reason it can’t happen to us. We’re bringing the shock factor."

* Read the full interview in this week's heat, on sale Tuesday

Do you have a story to sell? Get in touch with us at webcelebs@trinitymirror.com or call us direct 0207 29 33033
description: Love Island star Wes says he's not worried about the show damaging his relationship with Arabella Chi like Dancing On Ice did with Megan Barton-Hanson
